Name: CharacterSet
Description: Character set used in the data file (e.g., US ASCII, EBCDIC, UTF-8). This is a required field. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (CharacterSet) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

Name: ArrayBase
Description: Sets the array base for any arrays used in the definition (that is, whether the first value is in position 0 or 1, etc.). This may be the data array in a delimited data file or the measure array for measures that are bundled and stored in a single location. Array base is generally set to either 0 or 1. There is no override provided as systems processing a record would use a consistent array base.

Name: SystemSoftware
Description: Specification of a software package used to instantiate a data collection method.

Name: DataItemAddress
Description: Provides minimum information on data item address system, such as variable ID or Name, etc.

Name: DefaultNumericDataTypeReference
Description: Declares the most common data type used for numeric data.

Name: DefaultTextDataTypeReference
Description: Declares the most common data type used for textual data.

Name: DefaultDateTimeDataTypeReference
Description: Declares the most common data type used for date-time data.

Name: CodedDataAsNumeric
Description: Indicates that coded data should be treated as numeric, and defines the numeric type.

Name: CodedDataAsText
Description: Indicates that coded data should be treated as text, and defines the text type.

Name: DefaultVariableSchemeReference
Description: References a variable scheme for the RecordLayout. This can be overridden by individual data items if they are from a different variable scheme.

Name: ProprietaryInfo
Description: Contains information proprietary to the software package which produced the data file. This is expressed as a set of key(name)/ value pairs.

Name: DataItemP
Description: Describes a single data item within the file including its variable reference, information on the data type, and any item specific proprietary information.
